meanings.definition: Charks (verb): to mark or score with a sharp instrument
meanings.sent1: She carefully charks her initials into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist charks intricate designs onto the pottery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel charks a secret message on the fence.
meanings.sent4: His words chark deep into my heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The charking sound of the knife against the wood echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: Charks (noun): marks or scores made with a sharp instrument
meanings.sent1: The charks on the table indicated a history of craftsmanship.
meanings.sent2: The ancient cave walls displayed mysterious charks from long ago.
meanings.sent3: The detective examined the charks left behind at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: Her face bore the charks of time and experience.
meanings.sent5: The charks on the map guided them through the treacherous terrain.
